proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠EFJ, F on DG, ∠DFJ, ∠BEH, ∠CFH, G on FH, ∠JFH, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠JFG, F on EH, pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180) = ∠KGH, ∠KGD, ∠JFH, ∠HFC, E on DG, G on EH, ∠JFE, ∠HFJ, pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠FEB, BI || CJ, ∠DGK, AK || CJ, AK || BI, 3.14 = pi, E on DF, G on AK

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on FH, ∠CFH
Conclusions: ∠CFG = ∠CFH

Step 3:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠JFH
Conclusions: ∠JFH = 2 * pi - ∠HFJ

Step 4:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BEH, F on EH
Conclusions: ∠BEF = ∠BEH

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on DG, ∠KGD
Conclusions: ∠KGD = ∠KGF

Step 6:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠JFH, ∠EFJ
Conclusions: pi = ∠EFJ + ∠JFH

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on FH, ∠JFH
Conclusions: ∠JFG = ∠JFH

Step 8:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠HFC
Conclusions: ∠HFC = 2 * pi - ∠CFH

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : E on DG, ∠KGD
Conclusions: ∠KGD = ∠KGE

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on EH, ∠BEH
Conclusions: ∠BEG = ∠BEH

Step 11:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠JFE
Conclusions: ∠JFE = 2 * pi - ∠EFJ

Step 12:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠HFJ
Conclusions: ∠HFJ = 2 * pi - ∠JFH

Step 13:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : BI || CJ
Conclusions: ∠BEF = ∠JFE, ∠EFJ = ∠FEB

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on DG, ∠DGK
Conclusions: ∠DGK = ∠FGK

Step 15:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : AK || CJ
Conclusions: ∠AGF = ∠JFG, ∠CFG = ∠KGF

Step 16:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : AK || CJ
Conclusions: ∠DFJ = ∠DGK, ∠HFJ = ∠HGK, ∠HFC = ∠HGA

Step 17:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : AK || BI
Conclusions: ∠BEG = ∠KGE

Step 18:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠DFJ, E on DF
Conclusions: ∠DFJ = ∠EFJ

Step 19:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : G on FH, G on AK
Conclusions: ∠FGK = ∠HGA, ∠AGF = ∠KGH

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠EFJ + ∠JFH
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠EFJ + ∠JFH

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠JFG = ∠JFH, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠JFG
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠JFH

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠KGD = ∠KGF, ∠KGD = ∠KGE
Conclusions: ∠KGE = ∠KGF

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BEF = ∠JFE, ∠BEF = ∠BEH
Conclusions: ∠BEH = ∠JFE

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠FEB, ∠EFJ = ∠FEB
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠EFJ

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠AGF = ∠JFG, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠JFG
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠AGF

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CFG = ∠CFH, ∠CFG = ∠KGF
Conclusions: ∠CFH = ∠KGF

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HFJ = ∠HGK, ∠HFJ = 2 * pi - ∠JFH
Conclusions: ∠HGK = 2 * pi - ∠JFH

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠JFH = 2 * pi - ∠HFJ, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠JFH
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠HFJ

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BEG = ∠KGE, ∠KGE = ∠KGF
Conclusions: ∠BEG = ∠KGF

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DFJ = ∠DGK, pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠EFJ, ∠DFJ = ∠EFJ
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠DGK

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠AGF = ∠KGH, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠AGF, pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180) = ∠KGH
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)

Step 32:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, ∠HGK = 2 * pi - ∠JFH
Conclusions: ∠HGK = 2 * 3.14 - ∠JFH

Step 33:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, ∠HFJ = ∠HGK, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠HFJ
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((3 * y) / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠HGK

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BEH = ∠JFE, ∠BEG = ∠KGF, ∠BEG = ∠BEH
Conclusions: ∠JFE = ∠KGF

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FGK = ∠HGA, pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠DGK, ∠DGK = ∠FGK
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠HGA

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠JFE = 2 * pi - ∠EFJ, ∠JFE = ∠KGF
Conclusions: ∠KGF = 2 * pi - ∠EFJ

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠HGA, ∠HFC = ∠HGA
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠HFC

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HFC = 2 * pi - ∠CFH, pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠HFC
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠CFH

Step 39:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠CFH, ∠CFH = ∠KGF
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠KGF

Step 40:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠KGF, 3.14 = ∠EFJ + ∠JFH, ∠KGF = 2 * pi - ∠EFJ, ∠HGK = 2 * 3.14 - ∠JFH, 3.14 * ((3 * y) / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠HGK, ∠HGK = 2 * pi - ∠JFH
Conclusions: 1.2 = ∠JFH

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠JFH, 1.2 = ∠JFH
Conclusions: 1.2 = pi * ((3 * y) / 180)

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 1.2 = pi * ((3 * y) / 180), pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)
Conclusions: 1.2 = pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)

Step 43:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 1.2 = pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)
Conclusions: 1.2 = 3.14 * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)

Step 44:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 1.2 = 3.14 * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)
Conclusions: 28 = x
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(F, E, B)), Mul(pi, Div(Sub(Mul(5.0, y), 4.0), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(J, F, G)), Mul(pi, Div(Mul(3.0, y), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(K, G, H)), Mul(pi, Div(Add(Mul(2.0, x), 13.0), 180.0)))
